Summer is a state of mind.#summerfun
I’m sorry for the things I said when it was winter.
No place on earth as perfect to be as Summer’s splendor by the sea!#restingbeachface
It’s a smile, it’s a kiss, it’s a sip of wine … it’s summertime!
Sun is shining. Weather is sweet. Make you wanna move your dancing feet.#sunshine
Sweet smelling orange juice a drink that you can never refuse.
It’s a sure sign of summer if the chair gets up when you do.
Pack your bag, and pack lightly, then head to the nearest beach. Relax and get your needed vitamin sea.
A lot of parents pack up their troubles and send them off to summer camp.
It’s always summer somewhere.
Summer bachelors, like summer breezes, are never as cool as they pretend to be.
There is no ‘we’ in summer. Only ‘u’ and ‘me’.”
Summer: Hair gets lighter. Skin gets darker. Water gets warmer. Drinks get colder. Music gets louder. Nights get longer. Life gets better.
Oh! something you cannot miss, An irresistible treat is a summer holiday that is sweet…
Shall I compare thee to a summer’s day? Thou art more lovely and more temperate.
Deep summer is when laziness finds respectability.
Salt in the air, sand in my hair.
Let the waves hit your feet, and the sand is your seat.
It’s a smile, it’s a kiss, it’s a sip of wine…it’s summertime!
Tears of joy are like the summer rain drops pierced by sunbeams.
Because it’s summer and the memories are just waiting to happen.
Just the smell of summer can make me fall in love.
Friends, sun, sand, and sea. That sounds like a summer to me.
Why is summer mist romantic and autumn mist just sad?
Summer holidays are sweet, an irresistible treat. It’s all about fun, playin’ under the sun, makin’ sand castles, something that can cause no hassles.
One must maintain a little bit of summer, even in the middle of winter.
Be grateful for friends, hot sun, and clear water.
Summer’s splendor by the sea, a gentle, blue serenity. Caressing rays of golden sun, blushing, bronzing all who come.
It’s summer and time for wandering…
Summer vacation: where you drink triple, see double and act single.
By chance, or nature’s changing course, untrimmed; But thy eternal summer shall not fade.
Hip, Hip, Hooray for the Hot Summer Day!
The days draw out, the weather gets warmer, and it’s what we call summer, with a bitter laugh when we’ve said it.
Sigh… there goes another summer, Snoopy!
The tans will fade but the memories will last forever.
The end-of-summer winds make people restless.
Watching the summer close is like watching a good kid die for no apparent reason.
The morning had dawned clear and cold, with a crispness that hinted at the end of summer.
If June was the beginning of a hopeful summer, and July the juice middle, August was suddenly feeling like the bitter end.
September tries its best to have us forget summer.
August rain: the best of the summer gone, and the new fall not yet born. The odd uneven time.
When the winter comes, the summer shines infinitely in our hearts!
Summer is a promissory note signed in June, its long days spent and gone before you know it, and due to be repaid next January.
What good is the warmth of summer, without the cold of winter to give it sweetness.
The end-of-summer winds make people restless.
Summer should get a speeding ticket.
…summer softens lines that winter cruelly shows…
Hey Summer, come faster! Daying to meet you on the beach.
She got incredibly hot over last summer…
Oh Summer hurry up! I can’t wait to get salty.
Bikini ready saying hurry up Summer… I’m missing you!
If it could only be like this always — always summer, always alone, the fruit always ripe.
In the depth of winter I finally learned that there was in me an invincible summer.
I love how summer just wraps its arms around you like a warm blanket.
Just living is not enough … one must have sunshine, freedom, and a little flower.
A thin grey fog hung over the city, and the streets were very cold; for summer was in England.
I wonder what it would be like to live in a world where it was always June.
A breeze, a forgotten summer, a smile, all can fit into a storefront window.
In summer, intolerable closeness; in winter, unendurable cold. All the floors were rotten. Filth on the floors an inch thick; one could slip and fall…
O, Sunlight! The most precious gold to be found on Earth.
